roleset.name: copula
roleset.note: BE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'be' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from be.01-v predicate notes)

roles.note: Arg2 will probably be a PRD node, but NEVER a VP node!. (from be.01-v)

example.name: ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Ko has discovered that as more and more of these stores have opened in Kaohsiung , he and his wife go to department stores less , because in department stores you can only buy clothes , but in superstores you can buy daily necessities , hardware and so forth , and the selection is better .

example.name: Arg1, 2
example.text: George's being a brat ruined the field trip for everybody.

roleset.name: existential, existing
roleset.note: BE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'be' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from be.02-v predicate notes)
BEING-N NOTES: be.02. Corresponds to ontonotes sense 1. (from being.02-n)

example.name: ARG1
example.text: She discovered that there was n't a single open parking space among the hundreds on the first and second floors of the parking structure .
example.arg: a single open parking space among the hundreds on the first and second floors of the parking structure

example.name: Arg1, with adjectival
example.text: The existence of the hideous theatre, its very being, offended him so badly as to cause him nausea each day he passed the decrepit building.

roleset.name: auxiliary
roleset.note: BE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'be' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from be.03-v predicate notes)

roles.note: do not tag--no arguments! Will be followed by a VP node. (from be.03-v)

example.name: unk
example.text: The performance of these large retailers in Taiwan has been startling , and superstore chains from Holland , France , the United States and Britain have been arriving on these shores one after another .

roleset.name: be_like: multiword expression akin to "say"
roleset.note: BE_LIKE-V NOTES: This usage is common in data that contains spoken English. Examples taken from EBC. (from be.04-v predicate notes)

example.name: definitely spoken
example.text: When it comes to ABC *T*-1 they be like A B.

example.name: say
example.text: And I 'm like why 's the door open *T*?

example.name: one more example
example.text: I know 0 my producers are probably like ah uh.

roleset.name: say
roleset.note: BE_ALL-V NOTES: Based on SMS data. Comparison to be.04 and say.01. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from be.05-v)

role.descr: attributive, comment on utterance, topic of utterance

example.text: She was all 'thats horrible" about the breakup

roleset.name: evoke frustration or giving up; exceed one's tolerance
roleset.note: BE_IT-m NOTES: created by TIm for AMR

example.text: " That 's it! " Feng balled his hands into fists. " If the neighbors hear, she'll bring the police down on us.

roleset.name: be the correct answer to a need or a question under discussion
roleset.note: BE_IT-m NOTES: created by TIm for AMR

example.text: And she had a laugh that came from deep in her beUy Yeah, that 's it, a beUy-laugh.

roleset.name: be minimal, less than expected, be finished

role.descr: thing at the lower end of expectation (often 'that')

example.text: All that's changed is a diagnosis. That 's it.
I can maybe get you a pie, maybe two pies the most, that 's it. "
she says, " We'll talk later, " and that 's it for the conversation.
if there is a hung jury at this phase, the second time around, that 's it for the state of Arizona. They get two shots at the death penalty.

roleset.name: be a selected party, as in a game of tag.
roleset.note: BE_IT-m NOTES: created by TIm for AMR

role.descr: person who is now designated as it

example.text: She tagged him and shouted "You're it!"
